column2: This character keeps a mimic as a close friend and counselor. Wait, what?

The discovery and development of mythallars by Netherese arcanists allowed them to develop the spells necessary to create their floating enclaves, bastions of enlightenment, peace and ingenuity, giving the mages of Netheril sanctuaries from which they could continue their arcane research, safe from the distractions and dangers of the surface world.

The discovery and development of mythallars by Netherese arcanists allowed them to develop the spells necessary to create their floating enclaves. Recreating such wonders would require massive amounts of magic, resources and knowledge.

Thultanthar, now known as Shade, was created 1471 years before the Dalereckoning calendar. High mage Telamont had been experimenting with the Plane of Shadow for some time and had successfully shifted the entire city into the Plane of Shadow mere days before Karsus cast Karsus's Avatar and temporarily destroyed the Weave in the Year of Sundered Webs. Eventually, they managed to return to Netheril, or at least what was left of it. Searching for survivors for days, the city floated over the ruins of the Netherese empire. Finding none, the high mage assumed it was he work of the phaerimm and began planning his revenge. He stopped, however, when he realized that one city was not a match for them and that his subjects were likely the last of the empire's people. He abandoned those plans and retreated back into the Plane of Shadow, vowing that one day, they would return and reestablish the empire.

The Sembian mint is a fortress within the city of Ordulin, located next door to the Tower of the Guard, protected by powerful wards to prevent both unauthorized entry and scrying, as well as golems and patrols of particularly inventive abjurer craftsmen. It was said that no thief had ever penetrated the mint and lived to tell the tale.
The Harpers can't stand tyranny and oppression. As a High Harper, you can fight to free worshippers of the good-aligned deities from foreign despots.
The Harpers can't stand tyranny and oppression. As a High Harper, you can fight to free worshippers of the good-aligned deities from foreign despots.
The §Y[This.GetFullBaseName]§! will be liberated under a new ruler of a local religion! This ruler will become your §YTributary§!.
You'll be able to use the §GInvasion Casus Belli§! one time. You can try again if the invasion fails.
Belongs to a religion that respects or worships nature
Is an immortal or long lived character
NOT an immortal or long lived character
Some races aren't compatible with undeath

The criminal Shadow Thieves have forced the Masked Lords of Waterdeep out of the City of Splendors. As the owner of most of Waterdeep, you can recreate the Masked Lords and take your place as the new Open Lord.
Gareth Dragonsbane was the paladin king of Damara. Prior to his reign he was a famed adventurer, thwarting the schemes of the demon lord Orcus.
Mephistopheles is an archdevil who has long held a great deal of power in hell. Of all the schemers in hell he is the most open about his goals of total domination.
Once a mortal, Bane is the god of tyrannical oppression, terror, and hate, known across Faerûn as the face of pure evil through malevolent despotism.
Once a mortal, Myrkul is the god of death and decay. Myrkul's influence in Faerûn is spread through sparking unease and fear of death.
The godly dragon Tchazzar was convinced of his utter superiority. He treated everyone as expendable, but at the same time making efforts to ensure his subjects' loyalty.
Rashid and his bedine couldn't defeat Kel-Garas, a netherese lich, so he asked a phaerimm for help. The aberration gave Rashid's family the power they needed.
As another Bhaalspawn passes away, you realize that you're the last one standing. The entirety of Bhaal's divine power is now within your reach, will you grasp it?

The murderous god Bhaal foresaw his death and impregnated many mortal women, creating his heirs, the Bhaalspawn. If Bhaal's plans had gone as they were meant to, the Bhaalspawn would have destroyed each other until none remained, at which point his chosen followers would have performed rituals that would have brought him back. As a side effect unintended by Bhaal, the Bhaalspawn's share of the essence meant that each of them had the potential to become a god in their own right. That has come to pass today, as the last Bhaalspawn claims godhood.

For a time, it was believed that any possibility for Bhaal's resurrection had been stopped. The last known Bhaalspawn had fully absorbed the power of the deceased god, turning themselves into an independent, immortal divine being. Today, the last remaining bhaalspawn has fallen, and with all of his children dead, Bhaal's essence was freed, allowing for his resurrection. Bhaal was revived, and reclaimed the murder domain for himself.

For a time, it was believed that any possibility for Bhaal's resurrection had been stopped. The last known Bhaalspawn had resisted the murderous impulses caused by their lineage, sealing away the power of the deceased god. Today, the last remaining bhaalspawn passed away, and with all of his children dead, Bhaal's essence was freed, allowing for his resurrection. However, having his essence stifled and sealed off by his last host has weakened the Lord of Murder. He is no longer a true deity, and is instead a being of quasi-divine status.
Gods are never truly dead, it seems.

During the Time of Troubles, Bane and the young god Torm killed each other in battle. Subsequently, the majority of Bane's power fell from him to the mortal Cyric, who temporarily claimed the powers of all the Dead Three — all of whom perished in the Time of Troubles. A smaller portion fell to Bane's son, Iyachtu Xvim, an eventuality that Bane had anticipated should he himself perish. For Bane, death was but a temporary setback: today Xvim, who was in fact little more than a cocoon to contain the essence of Bane, burst forth into the black and armored figure of Bane, destroying the younger god entirely. All of Xvim's followers are quickly converting back to their old patron.

The most infamous weapon in a dragon's formidable arsenal is its devastating breath, which can produce blasts of elemental energy. The type of energy varies with the kind of dragon, and the older a dragon gets, the more powerful its breath becomes.
Childless rulers who are infertile or approaching old age can adopt an orphaned child, or an adult much younger than themselves.
§GThis is merely a reminder that you can adopt a friendly orphaned children, or an adult much younger than yourself, as a §Rtargeted decision§!.
Anyone may foster a child, but most rulers do not due to concerns of dynastic prestige and the legitimacy of their successor
Your capital, species or culture must be one that supports orphans
Where will you start your search for a suitable foundling?
The child will share your background
I will pay a visit to my less fortunate subjects.
The child's origins will be that of your capital
Has not adopted in the past §Y2 years§!
is a ruling §Yburgher§! of 5 years and is heirless
Do you desire a girl or a boy?
As you present the foundling to your subjects as the latest member of your family, you decide to name [adoptee.GetHerHim]:
Marry [Root.GetFirstNameWithNick]. The nobility will frown at you not growing your dynasty, but it is at most a minor inconvenience.
§GThis is merely a reminder that you can marry a lover of the same gender as yours as a §Rtargeted decision§!.
Take [Root.GetFirstNameWithNick] as consort. The nobility will frown at you not growing your dynasty, but it is at most a minor inconvenience.

Through ritual destruction of its central eye, a beholder can learn to channel and use magic much more quickly and efficiently. This sacrifice is necessary to any beholder who wants to be a wizard or a warlock.
You have been taught to follow a specific faith since childhood, but are you a real believer? There are so many options in the world of Toril, after all.
Invasion events spawn armies with an efficient troop composition.
Invasion events spawn armies with an efficient troop composition. Also, their numbers are doubled and they constantly reinforce to replace losses.
Non-religious adult characters may get the chance to convert to a religion appropriate for their traits. Rulers of diverse realms may get unique beneficial modifiers.
No additional options for religious conversion. Rulers of diverse realms don't get beneficial modifiers.

The King of Shadows has returned. Once known as the Guardian, he's a powerful creature, created to protect the Illefarn empire. Corrupted by the Shadow Weave during the fall of ancient Netheril, he lingered in the Plane of Shadow for many centuries, but he's now leading an undead horde, likely in an effort to reclaim the bygone Illefarn homeland.
His undead have died once, and they will die again.
The undead Army of Shadows was formed by the ancient King of Shadows of Illefarn to reclaim their former homeland and to turn it into a wasteland of undeath. You're probably not cut out for that job.

The archdevil Mephistopheles has emerged from the Underdark, intending to turn Toril into a new layer of Hell. He commands thousands of damned souls of drow, duergars, beholders and other subterranean races as a special form of spiritual army, and he's carving a path of conquest from Undermountain to Waterdeep.
He must be banished back to Hell.

The City of Shade has appeared over the skies of the Anauroch desert. Also known as Thultanthar, this netherese flying enclave survived the fall of Netheril by escaping into the Plane of Shadow. Its return can only mean one thing: the netherese shadovar aim to reclaim their ancient fallen empire.

In human form, the dragon Tchazzar forged a kingdom in Chessenta centuries ago. His great accomplishments inspired Chessentans into great religious fervor for him, especially after he feigned a glorious death and left the kingdom. Today, Tchazzar suddenly reappeared over the bay of Chessenta, seemingly intent on conquest.
A warmongering dragon demigod? This can't be good.

A few decades ago, a primordial being named Telos fell from the sky and crashed into the Vasaan tundra. A cult formed around the primordial, led by the one who would go on to be called the Voice of Telos. Using the power of the primordial, these so-called Warlock Knights are now preparing to seize control of Vaasa from the local rulers.

A group of fanatics called the Shining Crusade has formed in the Sword Coast. They are led by Caelar Argent, a charismatic woman of celestial heritage. Their ultimate goal is to descend into the hells through a portal beneath Dragonspear Castle, slay the devils within, and bring back to Faerûn those who died during the Dragonspear Wars.

The Shining Crusade has successfully reopened the Dragonspear portal to Avernus. Little did they know, a baatezu army led by the devil Belhifet was ready to greet them and to stage a counter-invasion. Once again, Dragonspear Castle is besieged by the hell's own legions.
The baatezu Hordes of Dragonspear was meant to be a invasion force of the Nine Hells on Toril. Why exactly are you in charge of it?
I see what you mean. Off it goes.
Receive a random major magic item.
War, strife and bad luck are making life difficult for this ruler and realm.
This character has recently become quite unpopular.
This character rules over a realm in which several different cultures are accepted. Trade and culture advancements are boosted.
This character rules over a realm in which several different religions are accepted. Culture advancements are boosted, and healing magic is more easily available.
This character rules over a diverse realm, in which many cultures and religions coexist. Trade and technological advancements are boosted, and healing magic is more easily available.
Gain a significant amount of experience points
Gain a moderate amount of experience points
Your otherworldly patron bestows a gift upon you for your loyal service.
As your connection to your otherworldly patron grows stronger, you are bestowed a magical gift. Which form will your pact take?
With the Pact of the Chain, you'll be gifted a cunning and useful servant. What type of servant would you prefer?
With the Pact of the Chain, you'll be gifted a cunning and useful servant. What type of servant would you prefer?
I need to weigh my options carefully.
The beings that serve as patrons for warlocks are mighty inhabitants of other planes of existence, almost godlike in their power.
This character's warlock patron is a lord or lady of the fey, a creature of legend who holds secrets that were forgotten before the mortal races were born.
This character's warlock patron is a powerful being of the Upper Planes.
This character's warlock patron is a fiend from the lower planes of existence.
This character's warlock patron is a mysterious entity whose nature is utterly foreign to the fabric of reality.
This character's warlock patron is a creature of the elements, perhaps a primordial, or a genie.

The beings that serve as patrons for warlocks are mighty inhabitants of other planes of existence — not gods, but almost godlike in their power. Various patrons give their warlocks access to different powers. Who will you beseech for power?
A celestial being of heavenly power.
I will make contact with the powers of the Far Realm.
One of the legendary lords of fey.
Primordials, genies, elemental princes...so many options.
Sacrifice [Root.GetBestName] to your dark patron in order to prove your devotion.
was offered up in sacrifice to hellish powers

The wicked [FROMFROM.GetTitledName] has sacrificed [From.GetTitledName] to devils! After bringing [From.GetHerHim] to a bloodied altar, [FROMFROM.GetHerHis] wicked priests placed [From.GetFirstName] on an altar and sliced [From.GetHerHim] open with a ceremonial dagger. They then consigned [From.GetHerHis] soul to the Nine Hells.
It seems that [From.GetTitledName] has not only gotten [From.GetHerHim]self captured, but also sacrificed by [FromFrom.GetTitledName] in order to propitiate an archdevil.

You lead the whimpering [FROM.GetTitledName] to the sacrificial altar, to be a sacrifice to your hellish overlord. Once you strap [From.GetHerHim] to the altar, one of your priests walks forward with a ceremonial dagger and slits [From.GetTitledName]'s throat, dooming [From.GetHerHis] soul to the Nine Hells.
was offered up in sacrifice to Cyric

The wicked [FROMFROM.GetTitledName] has sacrificed [From.GetTitledName] to Cyric! After bringing [From.GetHerHim] to a bloodied altar, [FROMFROM.GetHerHis] wicked priests placed [From.GetFirstName] on an altar and sliced [From.GetHerHim] open with a ceremonial dagger. They then consigned [From.GetHerHis] soul to their dark god.
It seems that [From.GetTitledName] has not only gotten [From.GetHerHim]self captured, but also sacrificed by [FromFrom.GetTitledName] in order to propitiate Cyric.

You lead the whimpering [FROM.GetTitledName] to the sacrificial altar, to be a sacrifice to Cyric. Once you strap [From.GetHerHim] to the altar, one of your priests walks forward with a ceremonial dagger and slits [From.GetTitledName]'s throat, dooming [From.GetHerHis] soul to the Dark Sun's whims.
was offered up in sacrifice to Loviatar

The wicked [FROMFROM.GetTitledName] has sacrificed [From.GetTitledName] to Loviatar! After bringing [From.GetHerHim] to a bloodied altar, [FROMFROM.GetHerHis] wicked priests placed [From.GetFirstName] on an altar and sliced [From.GetHerHim] open with a ceremonial dagger. They then consigned [From.GetHerHis] soul to their dark goddess.
It seems that [From.GetTitledName] has not only gotten [From.GetHerHim]self captured, but also sacrificed by [FromFrom.GetTitledName] in order to propitiate Loviatar.

You lead the whimpering [FROM.GetTitledName] to the sacrificial altar, to be a sacrifice to Loviatar. Once you strap [From.GetHerHim] to the altar, one of your priests walks forward with a ceremonial dagger and slits [From.GetTitledName]'s throat, dooming [From.GetHerHis] soul to the painful desires of our mistress.
was offered up in sacrifice to the Faceless God

The wicked [FROMFROM.GetTitledName] has sacrificed [From.GetTitledName] to the Faceless God! After bringing [From.GetHerHim] to a bloodied altar, [FROMFROM.GetHerHis] wicked priests placed [From.GetFirstName] on an altar and sliced [From.GetHerHim] open with a ceremonial dagger. They then consigned [From.GetHerHis] soul to their dark deity.
It seems that [From.GetTitledName] has not only gotten [From.GetHerHim]self captured, but also sacrificed by [FromFrom.GetTitledName] in order to propitiate the Faceless God.

You lead the whimpering [FROM.GetTitledName] to the sacrificial altar, to be a sacrifice to the Faceless God. Once you strap [From.GetHerHim] to the altar, one of your priests walks forward with a ceremonial dagger and slits [From.GetTitledName]'s throat, dooming [From.GetHerHis] soul to be consumed by our god.

Seeing [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledName] with [Root.PlotTarget.GetPossPronoun] nose deep in the cup, it suddenly struck me that all I need to get rid of [Root.PlotTarget.GetObjectPronoun] is some powerful holy water...
Celestial Lightsblood is said to be lethal to fiends and undead
Potent, concentrated holy water is more than enough
Suddenly, it hit me — poison wouldn't work, but there are substances that are harmful to undead and fiends! Surely the safest way to get rid of such a pest.
My co-conspirator, [From.GetTitledName], is asking for funds to buy some kind of substance that is harmful to individuals with a...unique physiology like [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledName].
[From.GetTitledName] has refused to fund the rare substance needed to off [From.PlotTarget.GetTitledName].
What a wonderful moonlit night... I feel like sampling some of that rare vintage I've been keeping in my cellar. You, servant, go and fetch it.

Poison! But it can't be, I would be immune to it! My insides are burning like an inferno...must be some kind of holy water...My body is disintegrating, but as my sight fades, I die loudly cursing my killer's name!

Poison! But it can't be, I would be immune to it! My insides are burning like an inferno...must be some kind of holy water...My body is disintegrating..someone, please help me! [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap]...
What is this? Holy water? Clever, but I won't be fooled. These worms will be brought to justice!
What is this? Some kind of holy water? I was very close to my true death tonight... Who would want me dead?

My co-conspirator, [From.GetTitledName], has let me know that [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledName]'s favourite drink will be spiked with powerful, concentrated holy water, perfect for incinerating such a creature from the inside...
[From.GetTitledName] approves of my idea to kill [From.PlotTarget.GetTitledName] with holy water. May [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] help me.

[From.GetTitledName] has let me know that the plot to kill [From.PlotTarget.GetTitledName] is proceeding well. [From.PlotTarget.GetSubjectPronounCap]'s favourite drink will be spiked with powerful, concentrated holy water.
Success! [From.GetTitledName] died, disintegrated by the holy substance we employed. Unfortunately, my complicity was discovered.
Success! It looks like some creatures can't stomach holy water very well! [From.GetTitledName] died not knowing the name of [From.GetPossPronoun] killer.
Failure! [From.GetTitledName] noticed something was wrong with the drink we spiked and my complicity was discovered.
Failure! [From.GetTitledName] noticed something was wrong with the drink we spiked, but was unable to uncover the conspiracy.
[Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledName] likes to take in the morning air on [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHis] balcony. A large piece of falling debris from the adjacent wall would land exactly on target...

My co-conspirator, [From.GetTitledName], is asking for funds to hire a specialist who will rig the wall near a balcony that [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledName] is known to frequent. The resulting debris should prove lethal...
I have learned that our mutual problem likes to take in the morning air on a balcony. A large piece of falling debris from the adjacent wall would land exactly on target...
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has sent the funds I needed. I can now hire a specialist to rig the wall adjacent to the balcony.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] refuses to provide the funds needed for hiring a specialist to rig the wall adjacent to the balcony.
As you lean forward on the railing, you suddenly hear a loud cracking noise overhead. The last thing you see is a large piece of debris falling towards your head. Then, only darkness.
I will haunt the mason who built that wall...

As you lean forward on the railing, you suddenly hear a loud cracking noise overhead. You see a large piece of debris falling towards your head, and quickly dodge it by flying out of the way. That was close...
Who would have done such a thing... and why?

My co-conspirator, [From.GetTitledFirstName], has hired someone to sabotage a wall through near a balcony [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstName] is known to frequent. A dramatic accident might take place soon...
[From.GetTitledName] approves of my idea to crush [From.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstName] under falling debris. May [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] forgive me!

[From.GetTitledName] has let me know that the plot to kill [From.PlotTarget.GetTitledName] is proceeding well. The wall adjacent to the balcony [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstName] is known to frequent has been rigged to collapse.
Success! [From.GetTitledFirstName] was crushed to death when the wall collapsed. Unfortunately, the mason who rigged the wall had second thoughts and revealed my involvement.
Success! [From.GetTitledFirstName] was crushed to death when the wall collapsed. A tragic accident, as far as anyone is concerned.
Failure! [From.GetTitledFirstName] dodged the falling debris at the last moment. The mason we used was detained and revealed my involvement under torture...
Failure! [From.GetTitledFirstName] dodged the falling debris at the last moment. At least [From.GetSheHe] is clueless as to who deserves the blame for this.
The One-Eyed God wishes for us to wage unceasing war against our enemies. We will kill, enslave or sacrifice anyone who stands in our way.
The orcs will never be able to compete with the other races, unless they learn how to build stable societies. We'll teach our warriors the value of honor, not just strength.
Put enough children of Maglubiyet together, and everything can be achieved. We'll take down our enemies with sheer numbers and great military might, and all of their treasure will be ours!
Maglubiyet's children are a very diverse bunch. We should strive to be more tolerant towards each other, and judge our fellows by their deeds, without prejudice.
§GTribal rulers have an easier time adopting feudalism§!
§GShort reign opinion penalty is less severe§!
§Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! belongs to a good religion, and the vassal belongs to an evil religion.

Whether cleric or commoner, wizard or warrior, nearly everyone in Faerûn pays homage to at least one patron deity. Faerûn is, however, a polytheistic world: over time, as a person grows and changes, so might their divine allegiances. Are you considering converting to another religion?
No, there's no need to change my ways.
I don't really care about the so-called "gods".
You've decided to change your religion. Only one question remains: will you embrace your new creed publicly, or will practice your faith in secret?
Keeping it a secret might be wiser, for now.
Over time, your realm has become a tolerant haven for people of different cultures. This is proving to be very advantageous, as our trade and culture thrive.

Over time, your realm has become a tolerant haven for people of different religions. This is proving to be very advantageous, as our culture thrives, and healing miracles become more available and commonplace.

Over time, your realm has become a true haven for people of different cultures and religions. This is proving to be very advantageous, as our trade and technological innovation thrive, and healing miracles become more available and commonplace.
Over time, your realm has become less tolerant to people of different cultures. This will end a prolonged period of booming trade and thriving cultural exchange.
The realm should become more stable, though...
Over time, your realm has become less tolerant to people of different religions. This will end a prolonged period of thriving cultural exchange, and the availability of healing miracles will suffer.
The realm should become more stable, though...
Your realm, once a shining beacon of cultural and religious tolerance, is becoming less diverse over time. This may spell the end of a prolonged period of booming trade and technological progress.
The realm should become more stable, though...
No, their heritage should be preserved.
This character rules over a realm in which several different cultures are accepted. Trade and culture advancements are boosted.
This character rules over a realm in which several different religions are accepted. Culture advancements are boosted, and healing magic is more easily available.
This character rules over a diverse realm, in which many cultures and religions coexist. Trade and technological advancements are boosted, and healing magic is more easily available.

[target_province.GetName]'s [target_province.Culture.GetName] inhabitants have been violently opposing your rule non stop. In fact, they are rallying under a strong leader and preparing to leave their former lands as we speak. [target_province.GetName] will now be scarcely populated, leaving room for our settlers to move in.
